intro: Loxostigma sesamoides, commonly known as the sesamoides loxostigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Loxostigma sesamoides is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
